headline: Intuit to Integrate USDC Stablecoin Across TurboTax, QuickBooks
summary: Fintech firm Intuit is working with Circle via a multi-year strategic alliance that will see USDC used across the firm's products.

headline: Circle Partners Intuit to Bring Stablecoin Services to Credit Karma, Turbotax, Quickbooks
summary: Financial services firm Intuit recently announced that it has entered a multi-year, strategic partnership with stablecoin provider Circle. Under the terms of the agreement, Intuit will leverage Circle’s USDC token and stablecoin infrastructure throughout its platform, which includes products such as Credit Karma, Mailchimp, TurboTax, and QuickBooks. While details are ...

headline: Intuit’s Consumer Platform Powers the Future of Tax Filing: TurboTax and Credit Karma Launch "Now This Is Taxes" Highlighting Trusted Tax Experts and Maximized Refunds
summary: MOUNTAIN VIEW, Calif., December 18, 2025--Intuit Inc. (Nasdaq: INTU), the global financial technology platform that makes Intuit TurboTax, Credit Karma, QuickBooks, and Mailchimp, today launched the second year of its successful brand campaign "Now This is Taxes" for tax year 2025 (taxes filed in 2026). The campaign demonstrates the future of taxes through its consumer platform, the only all-in-one destination seamlessly fusing Credit Karma and TurboTax with Agentic AI and human intelligence (AI

headline: Amazon Business Prime Offers Small and Midsize Businesses Even More Value with New Benefits from Intuit QuickBooks, CrowdStrike, and Gusto
summary: SEATTLE, December 18, 2025--Today Amazon (NASDAQ: AMZN) announced that Amazon Business has added even more value to the Business Prime membership program with benefits from Intuit QuickBooks, CrowdStrike, and Gusto that help small and midsize business customers save time and money. headline: Intuit CEO says Gen Z is staving off recession by putting it on plastic: ‘Credit card balances are up 36-37%, but they still have jobs’
summary: Gen Z is making more money, adjusting for inflation, than previous generations at their age, but their dollars aren’t going as far as before.

headline: How Investors May Respond To Intuit (INTU) AI Partnership Progress And Softer Margin Guidance
summary: In its most recent updates, Intuit reported fiscal Q1 2026 revenue of US$3.9 billion, up 18% year over year, while pairing strong segment performances in areas like QuickBooks Online and Credit Karma with more cautious forward guidance and adjusted EPS targets that fell short of analyst expectations. At the same time, Intuit has deepened its multi-year AI partnership with OpenAI across TurboTax, QuickBooks, and Credit Karma and announced governance changes, even as investors weigh softer SMB...
